setting.caption: Interactive
setting.desc: Sets Se into interactive mode

setting.caption: Profiles Location
setting.desc: Specifies the directory that holds the profiles that java clients can use to start up selenium. Currently supported for Firefox only.

setting.caption: Firefox Profile Template
setting.desc: Allows you to use a custom profile template instead of the default one

setting.caption: Forced Browser Mode
setting.desc: Browser mentioned here will be used by Se irrespective of what's passed in Browser Type

setting.caption: Forced Browser Mode Rest Of Line
setting.desc: Browser mentioned here will be used by Se irrespective of what's passed in Browser Type

element.caption: Forced Browser Mode Rest Of Line

setting.caption: BrowserSessionReuse
setting.desc: ?? stops re-initialization and spawning of the browser between tests

setting.caption: Avoid Proxy
setting.desc: set this flag to make the browser use our proxy only for URLs containing '/selenium-server'

setting.caption: Se Debug Flag
setting.desc: ?? puts you into debug mode, with more trace information and diagnostics

setting.caption: Browser Side Log
setting.desc: enables logging on the browser side; logging messages will be transmitted to the server. This can affect performance.

setting.caption: Ensure Clean Session
setting.desc: If the browser does not have user profiles, make sure every new session has no artifacts from previous sessions. For example, enabling this option will cause all user cookies to be archived before launching IE, and restored after IE is closed

setting.caption: Trust All SSL Certificates
setting.desc: Forces the Selenium proxy to trust all SSL certificates

setting.caption: Selenium Server Host : Port
setting.desc: Uses localhost as your selenium server.

setting.caption: Timeout
setting.desc: number of seconds after which selenium request would timeout

setting.caption: Proxy Injection Mode
setting.desc: puts you into proxy injection mode, a mode where the selenium server acts as a proxy server for all content going to the test application

setting.caption: Dont Inject Regex
setting.desc: an optional regular expression that proxy injection mode can use to know when to bypss injection

setting.caption: User Content Transformation
setting.desc: A regular expression which is matched against all test HTML content; the second is a string which will replace matches. These flags can be used any number of times. A simple example of how this could be useful: if you add '-userContentTransformation https http' then all 'https' strings in the HTML of the test application will be changed to be 'http'.

setting.caption: Multi-Window
setting.desc: Turning this Off will allow you to run Selenium within a frame. Should not be used for websites that use a frame

setting.caption: Keep Selenium Server Alive
setting.desc: When turned on, Qualitia will not shutdown the Se Server even after Qualitia finishes execution.

setting.caption: Browser Type
setting.desc: The browser that you wish to use to run your tests

setting.caption: Proxy Host : Port
setting.desc: Your proxy server if you are using one.

setting.caption: Proxy User
setting.desc: Your proxy username in case your proxy server requires one

setting.caption: Proxy Password
setting.desc: Your proxy password required for authentication

setting.caption: AutoIT Install Path
setting.desc: Path where you have installed AutoIT (AutoIT.exe). This is required only if you are using actions like Authentication, download and upload

setting.caption: Selenium Xpath Engine
setting.desc: The engine that Se would use to identify objects based on Xpath. Default Se engine is slower on IE. Use Cybozu (JavaScript-Xpath) for faster processing

setting.caption: New Browser For Every
setting.desc: New browser instance would be created for every \\r\\n test case / test suite

setting.caption: Java Install Path
setting.desc: Your java installation path

setting.caption: Selenium Server Jar Path
setting.desc: Your selenium-server-standalone-x.xx.x.jar path if you wish to override the default
